+package org.wso2.carbon.identity.configuration.mgt.server.cors;
+
+import org.wso2.carbon.identity.configuration.mgt.server.cors.exception.CORSServiceException;
+
+import java.util.List;
+
+/**
+ * Service for managing the CORS URLs of a tenant.
+ */
+public interface CORSManagementService {
+
+    /**
+     * Get all the CORS URLs belonging to a tenant.
+     *
+     * @param tenantDomain The tenant domain.
+     * @return List<String> Returns a list of CORS URLs configured by the tenant as strings.
+     * @throws CORSServiceException
+     */
+    List<String> getCORSUrls(String tenantDomain) throws CORSServiceException;
+
+    /**
+     * Set the CORS URLs for a tenant. This method replaces any existing URLs.
+     *
+     * @param tenantDomain The tenant domain.
+     * @param urls A list of CORS URLs.
+     * @throws CORSServiceException
+     */
+    void setCORSUrls(String tenantDomain, List<String> urls) throws CORSServiceException;
+
+    /**
+     * Add the CORS URL(s) to the existing URL list of the tenant.
+     *
+     * @param tenantDomain The tenant domain.
+     * @param urls A list of CORS URLs.
+     * @throws CORSServiceException
+     */
+    void addCORSUrls(String tenantDomain, List<String> urls) throws CORSServiceException;

timeline.bodyText:
we have a standard for internal error codes..  please refer "[Architecture] WSO2 Identity Server REST API Error Response Standardization"
Client errors in server APIs
For client errors in server APIs, we have allocated the range starting from 600.
Eg: USR-600xx

Server Errors in server APIs
For server errors in server APIs, we have allocated the range starting from 650.
Eg: USR-650xx

+

timeline.author: malithie

replies.bodyText:
for other similar OSGi services we followed the same approach. We defined a specific client error code and added a mapping to send 404 not found to the clients.
e.g.
https://github.com/wso2/identity-rest-dispatcher/blob/master/components/org.wso2.carbon.identity.api.dispatcher/src/main/resources/ErrorMappings.properties#L29
replies.author: emswbandara

replies.bodyText:
Is that the correct thing to do?
IMO, exception type should denote this other than further string processing
replies.author: malithie

replies.bodyText:
Yes. IMO we should fix this behaviour.
Current behaviour makes it very hard to check for the existence of something in the ConfigurationManager as it requires the callee to handle exceptions and check error codes just to see if something exists.
replies.author: mefarazath

replies.bodyText:
@ivantha please create an issue for this and point here.
We can look into that separately
replies.author: malithie

replies.bodyText: wso2/product-is#8555
replies.author: ivantha

timeline.bodyText: Ideally this service should be returning an unmodifiable list right
timeline.author: malithie

replies.bodyText: What is the purpose of returning an unmodifiable list rather than a plain ArrayList?
replies.author: ivantha

replies.bodyText: So that the consumers cannot manipulate.
replies.author: malithie

replies.bodyText: Changed to return Collections.unmodifiableList(corsOrigins);.
replies.author: ivantha

timeline.bodyText: It's not good to pass text information that should be in the message as arguments. It breaks readability.
timeline.author: malithie

timeline.bodyText: check my comment above
timeline.author: malithie

timeline.bodyText: check my comment above
timeline.author: malithie

timeline.bodyText: Can we rename this method? Something like 'isPreConfiguredCORSOrigin' or 'isDefinedCORSOrigin' or 'isCORSOriginAlreadyDefined'
timeline.author: malithie

replies.bodyText: Changed to isDefinedCORSOriginResource.
replies.author: ivantha
